Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-Device.udiCarrier

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*Extension(4.0.1)Unique Device Identifier (UDI) Barcode string
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:deviceIdentifier 1..1ExtensionMandatory fixed portion of UDI
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Device.udiCarrier.deviceIdentifier"
value[x] 1..1stringMandatory fixed portion of UDI
extension:issuer 1..1ExtensionUDI Issuing Organization
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Device.udiCarrier.issuer"
value[x] 1..1uriUDI Issuing Organization
extension:jurisdiction 0..1ExtensionRegional UDI authority
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Device.udiCarrier.jurisdiction"
value[x] 0..1uriRegional UDI authority
extension:carrierAIDC 0..1ExtensionUDI Machine Readable Barcode String
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Device.udiCarrier.carrierAIDC"
value[x] 0..1base64BinaryUDI Machine Readable Barcode String
extension:carrierHRF 0..1ExtensionUDI Human Readable Barcode String
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Device.udiCarrier.carrierHRF"
value[x] 0..1stringUDI Human Readable Barcode String
extension:entryType 0..1Extensionbarcode | rfid | manual | card | self-reported | electronic-transmission | unknown
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Device.udiCarrier.entryType"
value[x] 0..1codebarcode | rfid | manual | card | self-reported | electronic-transmission | unknown
Binding: ValueSetR5UdiEntryTypeForR4 (0.0.1-snapshot-3) (required): Codes to identify how UDI data was entered.
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Device.udiCarrier"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionDevice_UdiCarrier
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.Device.udiCarrier` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Device.udiCarrier` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `Device.udiCarrier` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`Device.udiCarrier` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `Device.udiCarrier` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `Device.udiCarrier` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `Device.udiCarrier` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `Device.udiCarrier` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Device.udiCarrier`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package.  Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.
element.comment: UDI may identify an unique instance of a device, or it may only identify the type of the device.  See [UDI mappings](https://hl7.org/fhir/devi.html#udi) for a complete mapping of UDI parts to Device.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.
element.requirements:
Element `Device.udiCarrier.deviceIdentifier` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Device.udiCarrier` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Device.udiCarrier.deviceIdentifier` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Device.udiCarrier.deviceIdentifier`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition:
Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices. For example, the US FDA issuers include: 
1) GS1: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-diI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 
4) ICCBA for other devices: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di # Informationsstelle f체r Arzneispezialit채ten (IFA GmbH) (EU only): http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/ifa-gmbh-di.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a jurisdiction. All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace with the appropriate repository uri as the system. For example, UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/us-fda-udi or in the European Union by the European Commission http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/eu-ec-udi.
element.requirements:
Allows a recipient of a UDI to know which database will contain the UDI-associated metadata. Element `Device.udiCarrier.jurisdiction` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Device.udiCarrier` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Device.udiCarrier.jurisdiction` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Device.udiCarrier.jurisdiction`, but has no comparisons.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - e.g., a barcode or RFID.   Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.
element.comment: The AIDC form of UDIs should be scanned or otherwise used for the identification of the device whenever possible to minimize errors in records resulting from manual transcriptions. If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

Element `Device.udiCarrier.carrierAIDC` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Device.udiCarrier` requires a cross-version extension.

element.definition: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.

Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices. For example, the US FDA issuers include: 
1) GS1: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-diI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 
4) ICCBA for other devices: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di # Informationsstelle f체r Arzneispezialit채ten (IFA GmbH) (EU only): http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/ifa-gmbh-di.

element.definition:
Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices. For example, the US FDA issuers include: 
1) GS1: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-diI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 
4) ICCBA for other devices: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di # Informationsstelle f체r Arzneispezialit채ten (IFA GmbH) (EU only): http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/ifa-gmbh-di.

The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a jurisdiction. All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace with the appropriate repository uri as the system. For example, UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/us-fda-udi or in the European Union by the European Commission http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/eu-ec-udi.
element.requirements:
Allows a recipient of a UDI to know which database will contain the UDI-associated metadata. Element `Device.udiCarrier.jurisdiction` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Device.udiCarrier` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Device.udiCarrier.jurisdiction` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Device.udiCarrier.jurisdiction`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a jurisdiction. All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace with the appropriate repository uri as the system. For example, UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/us-fda-udi or in the European Union by the European Commission http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/eu-ec-udi.

The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - e.g., a barcode or RFID.   Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.
element.comment: The AIDC form of UDIs should be scanned or otherwise used for the identification of the device whenever possible to minimize errors in records resulting from manual transcriptions. If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.
